page.title: 10ECOLOGY IN CHIPPERFIELD
page.content: {THE COMMON }once part of the Kings Langley Manor, is now owned by the District Council. After long neglect, the 4o hectares of woodland are now managed by a Common Ranger.Bramble and holly are being cleared to encourage growth of preferred trees. Spaces are being cleared for recreation. Nature Walk leaflet is available. Bridlepaths are clearly signed for horse _ riders.Apostles' Pool, once stocked with fish for Kings Langley Priory, is now dredged and cleared of reeds to allow access of light. The pond is full of tadpoles in spring and water beetles and snails abound. In 1983 twelve new lime trees were planted round the pond as replacements for the twelve old trees, believed to have been planted around 1714.Nearest the village centre, is the cricket ground which attracts crowds of visitors.
